text: QUERY FAULT TOLERANCE Most shared-nothing distributed OLAP DBMSs are designed to assume that nodes do not fail during query execution. — If one node fails during query execution, then the whole query fails. The DBMS could take a snapshot of the intermediate results for a query during execution to allow it to recover if nodes fail. - £2CMU-DB > y " ê é szou — I« » pl 4w 27:57/1:25:14 c c RIR © S i P m E 24 - Distributed OLAP Databases (CMU Databases Systems / Fall 2019)
